title: Improve new matrix plotting code
body:
## Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
We recently added some code for plotting matrices with metadata (see matrixplot and adjplot). There are some issues I already know about, including: 
- [ ] the brackets that are drawn to indicate "grouping" don't look great, and are missing the last tick for example.
- [ ] there is no option to move or turn off the large labels corresponding to "group" and "color" arguments. i also think these labels should be on the margins by default instead of taking up space on the top and side.
- [ ] the structure of the code should most likely have a class representation on the inside like seaborn's clustermap. there are far too many parameters floating around. i also think returning a lightweight class would be more convenient because the functions create a complicated group of axes, dividers, etc.
- [ ] I have a new application where I'd like to specify colors for the edges - this could get super complicated so not sure if worth doing. could consider an option where one can pass in multiple arguments to "data" and their treated like multigraphs
- [ ] I have new code to plot dendrograms on the margins of the adjacency matrices which would be good to include.
- [ ] Need to be able to pass in a title easily 
- [ ] Need to change the "color" arguments to "colors" to match seaborn as well as allow one to pass "color" to color the edges themselves.
